description: three sailboats on a smooth body of water; boathouse in center right; gray stone dock in LRQ
inscription: LLC, in margin, in pencil: Handprint no. 67 | lower right edge, in pencil: MX3J020A3
markings: LRC of sheet: blindstamp with letters OG2-L
provenance: (Thomas French, Fairlawn, Ohio, until 2017, sold to Kinney); Marla J. Kinney, Minneapolis (2017-19)
signed: LRC, in margin, in pencil: Berndt
text: Woodcut artists in Siegfried Berndt’s day liked to carve planks from cherry, pear, and linden trees. Berndt preferred walnut, a harder, more difficult wood that allowed him the precision of a metal engraver, witnessed by the stiff lines of these sails. There is a vertical line below the middle sailboat where the ink has pooled, perhaps reflecting an imperfection in the paper or a split in the block.
title: Sailboats on a Lake (Segelbboten auf einem see)
